identified mRNA transcripts from three genes CDSN, LOR and KRT9, showing strong over-expression in skin samples relative to samples from forensic body fluids, making them suitable markers for skin identification

We describe a young man who was a collodion baby and had the typical presentation of Loricrin keratoderma. Direct DNA sequencing identified a heterozygous mutation in the loricrin gene with a single G insertion, 730insG, present in (a) the patient

name: loricrin cornified envelope precursor protein

reactome.name: Differentiation of keratinocytes in interfollicular epidermis in mammalian skin

summary: This gene encodes loricrin, a major protein component of the cornified cell envelope found in terminally differentiated epidermal cells. Mutations in this gene are associated with Vohwinkel's syndrome and progressive symmetric erythrokeratoderma, both inherited skin diseases. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
